name: df-fbas
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cfbas, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cpw(cpw(cv(s0))), w3a(wne(cv(s1), emptycls), wnel(emptycls, cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wral(s3, cv(s1), wne(cin(cv(s1), cpw(cin(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), emptycls)))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ fBas =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ P(P(s0))|(s1 â‰  âˆ… âˆ§ âˆ… âˆ‰ s1 âˆ§ âˆ€(s2 âˆˆ s1, âˆ€(s3 âˆˆ s1,(s1 â‹‚ P((s2 â‹‚ s3)))â‰  âˆ…)))})
comment: Define the class of all filter bases. Note that a filter base on one set is also a filter base for any superset, so there is not a unique base set that can be recovered. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 1-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 11-Jul-2015.)
